column5: Well my son and his grlfreind are here for a few days visiting so we decided to hit a local pond this afternoon and Do some ice fishing.  We fished for alittle over two hrs and no bites but it was a fun afternoon all the same.....  Now This was my sons grlfreinds 1st time Ever out ice fishing.....and i am still chuckling from the question she asked and my sons ding dings....You will see what i mean after you have watched the video....lol    Nauti.
Seems to me I read on one of the carp sites that potatoes were the 'hot" bait a few years ago...  Don't know if they were french fried or raw...  Maybe Lorne (Hammercarp) knows...?
I watched a pike a raw potatoe that was sitting on bottom 2 years ago. I was amazed.  -R-
my kids catch fish on pieces of hot dog,balogna,ham
Weiner is my go-to perch bait.

I use to fish Hogs Back falls (part of the Rideau River system) in Ottawa some 39yrs ago for Carp when i was 11yrs old   ......there was a small ice cream and chip stand in the area and I would go through the trash and pick out leftover fries for bait....the Carp devoured them!!
Wow a pike eat a potatoe?.....lol......  Well maybe next time i take her out i will tell her to grab some curly fries and giver er a go!......lol  Thanx somuch everyone...
I'd rather get out and not catch anything then not get out at all. Nice video, and better luck next time.  Dirk....
Dont know about the tater,but I wittness guys here using good eaten shrimp for bait. For perch of all things. I was ready to put the ol smash and grab on them.LOL

I use shrimp from the shrimp rings u can buy from the grocery store. GT here in dover sometimes have them on for a few bucks through the summer time. So when minnows are scarce i use shrimp and they allways seem to work a treat.
Could not agree more Dirk.......Looking forward to getting out early am in the Morning....Hopefully with better luck.....
I'll say a prayer to the fish gods for you tongiht!
